definitions.definition: the outer or top part or layer of something:
examples: Tropical rain forests used to cover ten percent of the earth's surface.

definitions.definition: the top layer of a field or track on which sports are played:
examples: The match will be played on an artificial/all-weather surface.

definitions.definition: the flat top part of a table, cupboard, etc.:
to rise to the surface of water:
examples: The submarine surfaced a few miles off the coast.

definitions.definition: to cover a road or other area with a hard surface
working or operating on the top of the land or sea, rather than under the land or sea, or by air
